intro: Guettarda blanchetiana, commonly known as the white guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, with a smooth texture. Guettarda blanchetiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens and as a houseplant.
